alert.note: Alert for Southern Hidalgo (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 23 at 11:35PM CDT by NWS Brownsville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Hidalgo County through 1215 AM CDT... At 1135 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Sharyland, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... McAllen, Mission, Pharr, Weslaco, San Juan, Alamo, Donna, Hidalgo, Progreso, Palmview and Palmhurst. This includes the following highways... Interstate Highway 69 C between mile markers 1 and 2. US Highway 281 between mile markers 784 and 810. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
